chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph William Blair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 6/22/22.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges.  To be paid during perid of probation.  If revoked  to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possessin and defenant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court. Third paty contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Follow order in 21FA4552 exactly as written.
DV assessment imposed as to both counts.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent.  Credit for 96 days time served.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse  Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph William Blair

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph W Blair in court with attorney Fred Richardson via Zoom.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a restitution hearing. Discussion held between parties. State requests that restitution be set at $0.00 for reasons placed on the record. Defense does not object.
Court orders restitution to be set at $0.00.
Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case is being spun to Judge Richards Br 30. Parties notified and sent to room # 622, court house.

Defendant Joseph William Blair in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Joseph William Blair in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 96 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 96 DAYS time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Follow order in 21FA4552 exactly as written.
- DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 6/22/22.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Jury Instructions, filed.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Joseph W Blair not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Joseph W. Blair - #2022003175, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Letter from defendant.  (Joseph W. Blair - #2022003175, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Case heard by Judge Rosa, Branch 35 on behalf of Judge Kiefer, Branch 29:
Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Joseph William Blair not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case remains calendared in Branch 29.
filed.
Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear this case. Case spun to Branch 35, Judge Rosa's court. Parties notified.
Bail/bond hearing on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Parties have been notified of the next date set for a bail review.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Joseph William Blair in court by video with Attorney Fred Richardson who appears in person.  Defendant Joseph William Blair in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21FA4552 & 21CF3737. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Saltzwadel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Joseph William Blair not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by State argued and granted by the Court. Case remains calendared as previously set for a Preliminary hearing in branch PE.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with R.B, and any children in R.B's care under the age of 18. (D was using their mutual children to get messages to R.B)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Joseph William Blair in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Joseph William Blair in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph William Blair appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
Bail/Bond Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30am  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da

Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
